reviews.title: Old, dirty hotel
reviews.text: We stayed at the Downtown Hotel for two nights and it was horrible. We requested a room with a king size bed. They only a few of those, the rest are double beds....way too small. Anyway, our room was on the 6th floor on the street side of the hotel. It was so noisy with traffic and passersby that we couldn't go to sleep. We both wondered if we would sleep at all. Well, after 2 hours of noise, I got up and packed to leave this room. We called and asked for a room on the backside of the hotel. It was only after we got down to the lobby all packed, that they changed our room. It was much more quick, but old and dirty and only had 2 double beds. There was mold in the shower and the tile looked like it hadn't been cleaned in years. I was scared of the carpet too. There was still wrappers from the previous guests left in the floor.

reviews.title: Loved the hotel
reviews.text: Everything about this hotel is old. A remodel is needed to bring it up to date. The second night in the room brought noise from the parking lot in the back. There was a corvette convention staying there and they all felt the need to race their engines until midnight. Needless to say, I was eager to get out of there and back home to my own clean, king size bed.

reviews.title: Horrible, Trashy Hotel
reviews.text: Do yourself a favor and avoid this hotel. There are others that are nicer in the downtown area.

I have stayed at the hotel for five different trips and each time I have enjoyed myself completely. It's located right on bathhouse row and you can get out and walk to the stores and resturants. The price is very reasonable and the baths are located on the premises. You don't have to go someplace else to get the baths. The young ladies that do the baths are great. For the price you can not beat it.
reviews.title: Good hotel. Avoid the restaurant

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for a weekend and would have to say that it was the worst hotel I have ever stayed at. The prices are unreasonable and the hotel is nasty. The rooms are way out dated. I think the owners need to put some money back into this hotel because apparently they dont. The pillows are plastic covered and the beds are all full size. What hotel these days has only full size beds none that I know of. My husband and I had to squeeze into a full size bed., The worst night of slept in my life!!!!! The TV didn't work half the time and had to have been made back when dinosaurs roamed the earth. The decks where dirty and slanted forward which made it very difficult to stand out there. They still have actually keys to get into the room which worries me as previous people could have a key still to that room. Also to prove that this is a CHEAPLY kept hotel, they ask you to put a sign on your bed if you want you bed linens changed everyday. If you don't put the sign on the bed it doesn't get changed. Same with the towels if you leave them on the sink then they won't give you new ones as they tell you to leave on the floor for new towels. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone.
reviews.title: Do Not Stay Here!!! Don't Waste Your Money!!!

reviews.text: The lobby looks nice and clean, but the rooms were terrible. Maybe it was just our room, but there was hair on the sink basin, bathroom floor, mirrow had water stains all over it. The porch was so gross and dirty. I have stayed in hotels range from $30.00 -$400.00 a night, and this was the grossest one I have stayed in years and years and years. Even my 11 year old daughter begged not to stay. A clean room is all we expected, but didn't get that.
reviews.title: Dirty & Nasty
The Downtown Hotel & Spa - not what it use to be.....
reviews.text: Rooms needed updating a bit, ammenities were scarce. Be prepared to bring your own hairdryer & Coffee Pot, as well as some good fluffy pillows. The pillows were clean .....but in plastic. Didn't sleep well at all. Walls are paper thin.....if you get a room on the front side of the hotel, the view is nice but the clippity-clop of the horses will keep you awake all night. Staff very friendly.

reviews.title: Great place to stay!
reviews.text: I spent last weekend at this hotel, and had a lovely time. It's old, but well kept. We had one of the suites and couldn't ask for better. The food at the hotel was good and priced much lower than other places in the area. Enjoyed being able to walk to everything in the downtown area. Will go there again without a doubt. There is some noise from the street, but didn't really bother us.

reviews.title: Grreeaaattt!!!!
reviews.text: I stayed at the DownTown Hotel for three nights and it was great! The whole staff was great. My room had a great view overlooking the street. At night, it was beautiful! I took their thermal bath and massage and was ssooo relaxing! The location was wonderful! We could walk downtown and shop, go on tours, and view the old bath houses. I read the guys review about the broken window and he must have made someone very mad to do that. There is NO way that you can throw a beer bottle and hit a car from either side of the hotel. It must have been a freak accident. I have stayed there many times and nothing has ever happened to my car, truck, or motorcycle. The Downtown Hotel is "THE" place to stay in Hot Springs!!!! I recommed it to EVERYONE!!!
